worklist.oneSentenceDesc: As the number of sustainable travel-data collection programs increses, we implemented countless user-requested and internal features to support the growing user base.
tasks: Analyzed project requirements and user requests through self-led face-to-face stakeholder meetings.
Resolved over 20 front/back-end issues through pull requests, testing, and detailed/documented collaboration.
Restructured the data model in a highly-complex travel-data analysis pipeline server.
Rewrote a pre-existing Angular JS frontend, to a React Native version of the mobile app.
Implemented secured anonymous authentication using uniquely and randomly generated QR codes.

worklist.oneSentenceDesc: To support an expanding internal Knowledge Base, we designed a new search-bar based UI and database structure to support the new features.
tasks: Implemented a highly efficient differential/incremental database load script using Google Apps Script/Javascript.
Analyzed requirements and user needs through self-led stakeholder meetings.
Designed an intuitive user experience for a knowledge base document searching website.
Applied a Jira-centered agile methodology in a small 3-4 person team.

worklist.oneSentenceDesc: A web app used widely among CU Denver undergrad students in 2022, made by students for students, to visualize their course schedules and plan their future semesters.
tasks: Spearheaded a 4 person team making effective use of design patterns and project management tools.
Analyzed requirements and advisor/student needs through self-led stakeholder meetings.
Designed and developed a web application that garnered widespread positive adoption among classmates.
